conbody.p: Azure Data Lake Store destinationprereq: register Data CollectorprerequisitesAzure Data Lake Store destinationTo allow the Azure Data Lake Store destination to write to Microsoft Azure Data Lake Store, grant execute permission to the web application for the folders that you want to use. When using directory templates in the destination, be sure to include all subfolders.

ol.li:
If continuing directly from retrieving details from Azure, in the navigation panel, click Data Explorer.
Otherwise, log in to the new Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com/. From the All Resources list, select the Data Lake Store resource to use, then click Data Explorer.
If necessary, click Create Folder and create the folders that you want to use.

To grant write access to a folder, select the folder, and then click Access.
The Access panel displays any existing permissions.
To add the web application as a user, in the Access panel, click Add.
In the Assign Permissions panel, select Select User or Group.
In the Select User or Group panel, scroll and select the web application that you created, and click Select.

In the Select Permissions panel, configure the following properties:
For Permissions, select Execute to allow to write to the folder.
For Add to, select This folder and all children.
For Add as, you can use the default, An access permission entry.
Click Ok to save your changes.
The web application displays in the Assigned Permissions section of the Access panel.

conbody.p: Now that all prerequisite tasks are complete, you can configure the Azure Data Lake Store destination.
